intro: Ledocarpon microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved ledocarpon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. This plant is typically found in moist, calcareous habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It is native to parts of Europe and is often associated with open, sunny environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
